transcript.content: Red Hot Chili Peppers - The Zephyr Song
Red Hot Chili Peppers on XFM 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant...

Don't be nervous, uh, we- we might see a difference in Karl, he's a little shy, um, there's someone here from the BBC filming this part of that celebrity boxing thing, "The Fight", I think it's called and they're... they want to get a little clip of this so we're gonna let 'em film for a minute and then they're gonna go away. Is that all right Karl?
He doesn't want, he doesn't want to be on camera, do ya? Do ya?
I think it ruins radio, dunnit?
Well not for the people listening, it doesn't.
Yeah, but it does because people are like "Ooooh, that- he sounds like a bit of a looker."
Yeah, and then they'll see it on the telly and they'll go, "God, yeah, you know, his head is round."
Guess what? I got a call yesterday, um- you'll love this Steve...
From MTV and uh, they were wonderin' if um, they could screen test Karl.

I'm lovin' it and I was goin', "Yeah and I come" - I said, "Yeah, yeah it is fine. I'll come down with him" and I was sayin', "What about this, that and that" and they were lovin' it, I called him up and he went, "Oh nooo", I went, "Why not?", he went "Well, I'm looking at my reflection now in the mirror", he said, "I shouldn't be on the telly".

What would you wear for your screen test, Karl? What kind of look would you try to cultivate, 'cause you've got to bear in mind that the audience out there, they don't know what you look like, so would you be a snappy dresser like say, Jonathan Ross, or would you go for your kind of street-cas look--
Can't, can't, can't wear a suit. Don't--
So I'm thinking, uhh... I don't know, I'll probably wear me wooly hat cuz that takes some years off me.
It does, he looks about 10 with a wooly hat on.
Is it quite a cool wooly hat or has it got a bobble?
It's charcoal. I'd say it's the "in"- "in" color.
Umm, and I'd probably wear me, uh, me anorak.
Oooooohhh, he's goin' for the- he's goin' for glam!
He's goin' for the wooly hat and anorak look!
He's going for quite a glam look! Oooh!
No one else has done it.
But I'm not- I'm not that happy about it all, to be honest.
Are you gonna do it? You're not gonna do it?
Well... I'm sort of stuck in the middle, cuz, throughout my life so far...
I've always just- I've never planned for anything, right, it's just always happened.
The time --  ya know what I mean? -- bein' in plays at school - never planned it, but when I did it, I went down a storm.
It was a triumph, yeah we all remember that.
As I remember you did "Little Donkey"?
And then later someone was filming at the back - was it your dad's mate?
Yeah and on the camcorder- he listened to it back- watched him playing it- his dad says... just off-camera... What's he say?
I don't wanna say it cuz I'm in charge of the show, and I th- it'd be irresponsible.
And so he gets home, list- watchin' that and then hears his dad just off-camera go, "He looks like a right twat."
What are ya worried about? You're dad sayin' that or the word--

Can I just interject because I'm really worried about this idea of Karl being on MTV because the problem is that, you know, let's be honest Rick, I mean we're, we're gettin' by the skin of our teeth, aren't we really?
It's only Karl that's keeping this afloat.
And if he gets on MTV and the world sort of gets a sense of him and they understand him and, and he, he won't be ours anymore, we won't be able to control him, he'll be out there, he'll be in the--
Well, that, that's the thing- no- that's the thing, that's the terrible thing though, isn't it? It's like Karl is my pet but I realize I've got to release him into the wild sorta--
And, you know, because I love him, I know he's gotta go free--
Maybe someone will beat him to death and we won't have to worry.
I'll have you on though, I'll have you on as a guest.
Which gets me on to something we've got coming up today.
Oh yeah, he's got a new idea.
Ehm, do you know, like- I've talked about ghosts and we had that good discussion the other week walking to--
And I was telling you about ghosts and you were saying, "Karl, don't be an idiot" and all that. Uhh, spoke to a woman in the week. Done a little interview with her--
You've done a little interview? Brilliant.
Done a little interview. Two minutes or so with, uhh...
With a woman who's, who's got ghosts in her house.
I look forward to hearing that later, that sounds brilliant.
Well I'm gonna play a classic tune now. I've- I've just gone straight for it, I've gone for the jugular, this is "Ziggy Stardust" by David Bowie.
"Ziggy Stardust" by David Bowie on XFM 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington. Karl's also nervous because he had a bit of shock last week, didn't ya?
His, uh, his dad tuned in.
Yeah. Um, and Karl's never told him that he actually speaks on the show, he just says, "I press the buttons", right. He's kept him from it. You used to do radio before, you never told him did ya?
Yeah, yeah. And so he's never told him since but... but they've promised not to listen, haven't they?
Well, me dad said.... uhhh, me mam said to me, "Don't worry, don't be put off this week"--
You know, "I've told him he can't listen." But I heard me dad in the background kind going, "Bollocks!"
So, he might be listening. So that's extra pressure. Plus a camera crew in.
I know! You don't like it, do ya?
This is good training for MTV cuz then he can watch you on TV and what's he gonna make of that?
You don't keep your hat on when you're with him and say, "Oh, no I just press the buttons", huh?
It's just, it's just, you know, it's like when, when I was in any plays I didn't tell him...
Ehm, any sort of parents evening, I never gave him the note.
So what did the teacher - so you were just an orphan?

No, just on an off-chance, um, my mate's dad spoke to me dad once, I think, and sort of said, "Oh, you goin' to school to see how", you know, "your kid's doin'?", he was like, "What are you talkin' about?"
He said, "There's a parents evening." So he went--
He went to one and that's when Mrs. Matthews said I'd never be a high flyer.
I think we should call Mrs. Matthews and make her eat her words.
Uhhhh, she'll turn on to MTV one- I don't know like their- their "slammin' session"--
And there- go- and go, "That's young Pilkington!"
Yeah. Um, did you see "Celebrity Fit Club" yesterday?
I missed it. I didn't watch any TV this week- the only TV I watched was, um, "Are You Good In Bed?"... I already knew the answer.
Was it- you have to tick points?
Well, talkin' of "off the scales" - Rick Waller.

Well, what he did is, he lost, he lost weight and they couldn't believe it and he had a big argument with Harvey and they said, "Go, never come back to-", right, and then he got to weigh in and he'd lost, sort of, like, 10 pounds or sommat.
And, uh, they were really- they said, "You've been starving yourself, haven't ya?" and he admitted it... and uhm--
But he just really wasn't wearing his underpants.

Yeah, yeah. But, um, but he was whinging all the time. I was watching it- he was doing a press, he was goin', "Aw, I've hurt me arm". Then he was going, "I feel sick". And then he was going, um- and he was just lying all the time about whether he was doing the routine and what- about what he was eatin' and stuff and I thought, "That's me" because I had the "Celebrity Box-"
Yeah, it sounds like you. It sounds like you.
It is, because it's sort of like- and they go, "How's it going? You haven't had a drink this week?" and I go, "Nooo."
Hadn't had a beer this week, nooo. "Did you do the excersise today?" and I go, "Yup. Yeah, I've done all that, done all that, done all that".
And I try to get out of the sparring because it hurts, because there's a man hitting me in the face for fun, umm--
Right... the... cuz you know that's what boxing is? You are aware that--
Again, that is- being hit- yeah. I like all the, I like all the bits... except the being hit. I don't even mind hitting someone!
I'd- I'd be willing to hit someone.
It's the getting hit that I don't like.
Cuz I know you're a big fan of... umm... like, wearing the clothes, the sort of sporty gear, I know you love--
You look good and you've obviously spent their money.
They've- they've give- no- no, they gave me this for training.
Oh, that's free of - free of charge!
So I know that's a perk you love.
And I know you like, um, kind of, the uh, the sort of, the various sort of nutritional drinks you've got to drink, I know you're a big fan of those.
I love the protein shake cuz it tastes like chocolate.
D'ya know what? I've put on a couple of pounds since I've been doing this training.
I think it is the extra meal and uhh--
So you're adding the protein but not working out enough--
To, to take it off again.

Yeah, but I th- I think I've umm, I have actually changed a bit. I've got a, a umm, inch on my chest but an inch off my waist, so even though I've put on weight, I- there must be a little bit of muscle happening.
So I- so just to- to recap there slightly: you- you're enjoying all the trappings of boxing--
Not the gettin' hit in the nose.
And you are aware that that's what will- that's what will be happening during the actual fight?
No, because I've got a cunning plan.
I'm gonna n...... duck and dive.
Well I read in the paper yesterday - I don't know how much truth there is - that uh, Grant Bovey is recruited celebrity hypnotist Paul McKenna--
So I don't know if that's of any- because I know that you've got- haven't you got ehm- haven't you got, uh, Spit the Dog--
a couple of ventriloquists and an impressionist on your side.
Yeah. I've got Pork Pie from "Desmond's"--
Mentally. Yeah. Well, I don't know, it's all a bit of fun and--
What do you reckon, Karl? Do you think he's uh, in with a chance?
W- well what's- what's McKenna gonna be doin'? Is like Grant Bovey gonna be turnin' into a chicken and... you know what I mean?
Yeah, he's gonna do an Elvis impression--
If I say the right words.
No, I think it's probably- he's probably just gonna have him focus and--

Yeah, he's- he's- yeah he's- he does that- yeah I think there's lots of sports psychologists at the moment getting people- so I'm sure it's uhh, I'm sure it's valid - if it's true - I'm sure it's uh, fine.
But, I've been- I've been- I've been getting tuned mentally learning how to hit.
That was my method. Eating and hitting, I think is...
And do you workout to any music? I mean, do you put on the "Rocky" soundtrack? Because, I know you've got um--
A special CD with all- music from all five films, haven't you?

No, but don't- no, it's all- it's um- I think they have the radio on down there but you don't hear it. It's- all you hear is people shouting, saying things like, "That's not like a fighter!" and me going, "I'm not a fighter!"
And is it quite intimidating down there?
I mean do they- I mean I'm sure they're nice people but is it like--
It's- I mean I'm getting used to it now but it is- it is- it is a different world and I was quite scared and I- I didn't like --
When you say, "it's a different world", is it like, is it like they're gangsters? I mean, is it kind of--
I don't mean- I just mean, has it got that feel, you know when you see it in films they walk into those places and, you know, they're kind of, they're hard nuts and there's that feel like--
Well they're, I mean, well they're, they're all, you know, they're all ex-boxers and stuff so, yeah, but I mean- but no they're not- they're- no- that's- that's not what I mean, I--
I suppose it's like they're real men.

Well yeah and um, they- they don't- they don't understand, really, that I'm- I don't like getting hit on the nose. And they say, "Well, no one gets hit on the nose" and it took me a long time to get over that- just, just taking a couple of punches.
I wanted to rule it out.
And, uh, umm, but you know, it's okay now. And of course they're- I know they're moddy-coddling me, they're not- they're using about 25% power where--
And you wear the head gear, do you?
Oh yeah! Yeah, and the gum shield, yeah. I wanted to wear a crash helmet--
But they said, "No"... and carry a baseball bat and they said that, that's technically illegal.
But I'm looking forw- I'm a changed man, Karl. What have we got coming up?
Got a bit of a, uhh, Death In Vegas with vocals from Liam Gallagher.
Do you think you'll carry on boxing after this is finished?
No, no, no, just the training and stuff and--

Yeah, I love the- I love the training, I love learning the- the skills and that and I do enjoy the training. I don't- I don't relish getting punched around and I'm not- I'm not worried about the fight at all, I'm really looking forward to the- the fight because um, Grant's a novice like me. It's just when you get in with an ex-pro who you know could destroy you any--

So you're scared of him and you know, they never lose their rag and they're really cool and they're really nice and they'd never act- they'd never even hit me by mistake but even just tapping you, like that--

It's just- I was walking down Finchley Road the other day and a couple of sixth-formers said, "Oy, yah lanky goggle-eyed freak" and I just wondered if maybe you could pop 'round and have a word with them?
Yeah... an enemy of yours is an enemy of mine.
Death In Vegas feat. Liam Gallagher - Scorpio Rising
"Scorpio Rising" - Death in Vegas on XFM 104.9. Steve...
I'm Ricky Gervais, Karl... Karl was a little bit more- less stressed now. The camera crew have gone, his dad's not listening... we think.
I'll tell you what though, me uhh, me mum's lovin' it.
I love- do I know Rockbusters?! I love Rockbusters. I think- I dream of it.
She was takin' part. I mean, she doesn't know a lot of the, the new bands and that, but she, uhh, she made some up for, uhh, some older bands and that.
Oh, she- she did some herself?
She made some herself. Sent 'em in the post.
So are you gonna use them today?
Ehhm, she's not quite got the hang of it.
Have you got them now? Can we hear what they are?
Well, you keep talkin' a second then.
I'm quite excited, I mean, if they're- if they're even approaching, say, the genius of "Wet-Knee-Houston"--
Uh, there was another one that was something to do with a trench, Karl, what was that? I can't think--
Oh, that was Dandy Warhols, that was a good one.
I think that was his- that was his finest moment, yeah.

Incidentally, I've had an email here from, uhh, someone called, "Sam", I don't know if that's a he or a she, but let's assume it's a she just for uhh, glam's sake. Uhm, she says she saw an old man eating a Twix last week, Karl, so that blows your theory out the window.
So if you are a bloke, he's calling you a liar, so... maybe want a little rumble later--
In fact, if you are a bloke, he's calling you a girl.
Right, here you are then. Uhhm, these are ones that me mam's made up. Uhmm...
Right, just in case you're a new listener, I give some initials out and a cryptic clue and- and it makes up a band, dunnit?
Not so much "cryptic" as wh- what you're thinking. But go on.
Well, uhh, me mam sent this one, uhh: "This group would be good at doin' your hair."
"This group would be good at doing your hair"?
Is there a group called, "The Hairdressers" from the sixties?
"This group would be good at doing your hair"--
Yeah, so that's, that's all right -
Uhhh, let's have a look, uhh, "This group sound like dinosaurs"...
It's... yeah... I see what you mean, they're not so much cryptic are they?
Oh leave her alone, they're good.
"This group likes bein', uhh, by the sand and the- and the sea."
"This group likes to be by the sand and the sea".
Are they the Beach Boys by any chance?
"This band are called, 'The Beatles'" - Uhh, The Beatles?
We just have, just have a- a couple more...
Ricky Attempts To Use Words And Laughs Harder
Ummm, it's funny 'cause, 'cause one of them that she's done I'm actually doin' today- I thought of in the week. So...
Right, is it the same clue?
Here's the last one from her: "This guy sounds soup-perb".

I think- I'll tell ya this: I think you should get on to one of the big game, uhh, organizations, Parker Brothers or whatever because this has gotta be- I mean this could sweep the nation at Christmas, don't you think? I mean, this is the perfect Christmas game.
Well, I think this is what's gonna make or break the MTV thing...
I'm just thinkin' into ad breaks, you know, "Comin' up next: is this band--"
Be careful though, Karl, because, you know, make sure you retain the rights because I can see this selling abroad--
And I can see someone coming along and taking the, sort of, like, the, the "Rockbusters" and changing one word and they can make like another game out of it and- just usin' the same format.
I don't know, I don't know.
I don't know, uhhhhhhh, I can't think off the t- but they could change- so- so--
They could change the word "Rock" to something else and have it...
What could it be... brick? Block?
Yeah, and so you'd have to- you know what I mean?
So, uhhh, so yeah, so we're doing that later. Got some good prizes.
Okay. We'll talk about the prizes afterwards.
Talk about that in a little bit. Ummm, Educating Ricky--
We've got the woman who's got a ghost in her house.
Yep. It's a shame she's not here live because I feel like I want to ask her a few questions, Rick. I don't know about you.
Don't worry, I've covered it all.
You've covered it all! Of course!
Jim O'Rourke - All Downhill From Here
Rick, em, I know you, like me, are just too busy, really, to keep abreast of new music aren't you?

We're busy people, we got, you know, important show business parties to go to and stuff. That's why I have friends of mine who send me compilations and stuff. That's one of my quarterly compilations from my friend Harry and that's "All Downhill From Here" by Jim O'Rourke.
I've got a new track comin' up later actually--
That I think you might like so, uhh, you know, we're- we're um- we're inflaming each other's desire for new songs as well as going back to the back catalogue- some classics.
All right? I love adverts better though.
Missy Elliot on XFM 104.9. Ricky Gervais, with me Steve and Karl.
Karl, why have you got headache?
Just a bit stressful 'cause the move's- move's on this, uhh, this week.
Oh by the way, the XFM listeners came 'round to me house and bought the, uhh, futon and table.
Quite normal, quite normal. They were well happy.
Couldn't believe their luck with it.
What do you mean, "quite normal"? What do you mean, "quite normal"?
Well, it's always a bit scared innit, gettin'- gettin' people 'round.
And were they excited to see you? Could they- I mean, could you tell that they were pretty- pretty pleased to see you?
No, I don't think so. I mean--
(Pause) Yeah, but the- the fella's sort of- I mean they brought the whole family around, which was a bit odd.
Well it's not often they get the chance to- to visit a living freak.

And you're moving now, are ya? He said- he phoned me up today- he know- he was absolutely tippin' it down, right, (Laughing while trying to speak) he had to cycle in, right, cuz he said because of the move he doesn't want to leave his bike 'round there. And he said- (laughing) he said- and Suzanne- oh I can't say this in case he's listening, can I?
All right, he said, "Suzanne's hired the oldest removal man in London."
And the thing is, right, we've booked him- we booked him because everyone else happened to be booked out but this fella's free... All right?
So he called up this morning and I've never spoke to him but he was on the phone, he sounded about ninety.
Karl thinks that he's gonna have to do all the work!
W- Well, he seemed to be cheap--
All he wanted were some Werther Originals.
Right, listen, he seemed to be cheap because it's fifty pound an hour...
But how long is it gonna take him?
Ricky Pounds On The Desk While Still Laughing
When's the move on, then? When's the--
I don't know, he's comin' 'round- he came 'round today to bring some empty boxes and was struggling with them!
Ricky Turns From Laughter To Hiccupy Sounds
It- it actually happens on Wednesday.
Rick, I noticed there you were laughing and almost had a heart attack. Doesn't bode well for the boxing much does it?
I've got a cough at the moment though, don't I? I'll have me Lemsip.
Anyway, what we doing now, Karl?
Well umm, ... I teased ya with it before...
Are ya gonna get it out again?
I, uhh... I'm always, like, tryin' to get your, you know, thinking- opening, opening your mind up a bit to--
So uhm, this woman who I know, she uhh, she said she'd come in and I could interview her to try and, sort of, you know, get the belief out there.
Yeah, because there's not enough belief in the occult and rubbish out there.
So does she- she thinks she has a ghost?
She has, yeah, she's had a--
She has. No, it's fact! Yeah, she has.
So, I thought maybe it's a new feature we could try for a couple weeks, see how it goes down.
My guest today is Tarrin, she's a plugger, uhh, you're still a plugger, aren't you?

Right, she does co-management but she was a plugger, she looked after Therapy, Raging Speed Horn, Slash, all the big names. Yeah? Uhmm, but we're not here to talk about music, we already do a lot of that on XFM. Today we're talkin' ghosts. Now, Ricky and Steve, who I do the show with, they, uhh, they're not havin' any of it. So, I said, "Well, I know someone who, uhh, you know, gets on with ghosts, knows a lot of 'em." So I thought I'd get you in today, have a little chat for a couple a minutes. Ehh, just to sum up the story so they get an idea of what happened, uhhm, you had a horse, yeah? You had it in some stables--
(Interrupting) He hasn't let her speak yet!
Uhh, you went to, like, look after it an' that.
Play around with it, take for a ride an' that--
Yeah. Uhm, two of your mates were in the stable where your horse is.
Not my stable, in the opposite stable.
They're messin' about and that, yeah. You heard 'em havin' a laugh. So you thought, "Right, what are they up to?" So you go in and they're messin' about with a Oiuja board.
Right. So, this is where you come in. Did you get involved with the Ouija board?
Right, and what happened then, then?
I was like, "Oh you don't believe in this? Oh, let me have a go."
And, eh, asked a few questions, put our hands on and it actually started moving.
So a lot of the stuff you asked it, has that- did the things happen that you asked?
Right. Well that's scary for a start. Right? We haven't even got to the ghost bit yet. So, you mess about with that--
"Trapped soul",  I like to call him.
All right, "trapped soul". So you're messin' about on the Ouija board, you say, "Right, I've had enough of this now."
"I've got all the answers I need."
You go in the house and it's a bit nippy.
The house- the flat is absolutely fine, it's when I went into the bedroom. You've got to remember, it's a very, very warm, hot evening...
And walking to the bedroom, I no- note it is cold- colder than usual. But I'm actually quite glad because it's so hot.
Completely ignored the fact that windows were all shut but the curtains were blowin'. Didn't sleep well at all.
Yeah, I was fast asleep, get woken-up, the wardrobe's openin'.
So at this point, this is where we clear up, you're not, you're not on crack, you're not--
No, never touched drugs in my entire life!
I will have the odd glass of red wine.
Yeah... Right. That, that, that's all right, they recommend that anyway. They say it's good for your heart.

What started happening was, as the week progressed, I also felt the bed covers, at one point at night, fold over- double bed, the bed covers fold over and it was like someone was getting in the bed next to me. But you've got to remember, when you're in a deep sleep...
You're not quite thinking and you're thinking, "I'm losing it."

I was getting more and more tired, more and more, a little stressed and really thinking I was having a break-down. The final straw was when the clothes on the end of my bed, that I just throw, hit me.
How come you were going back home at night?
Because I was skeptical. In fact, six months ago, I'd of said, "I don't want to go there, people will think I'm mad", but you know what? I don't care.
I know there's more out there.
Well... brilliant. Well, cheers for that and, uhh, thanks for bein' a guest on, uhh, on "Pilkington".
I like the fact that you've learned a lot from Parkinson even stealing some of his questions like "Are you on crack?"
Which I know he always asks his guests.
Yeah, yeah. I like the fact that when she went, "I dunno, I have the occasional red wine" he goes, (Karl Imitation)"Well, that's all right for ya... good for your heart."
It was brilliant, although I feel--
That was the best interview technique I've ever heard anywhere.
I- I feel like there's still some questions unanswered.
(Loudly) Uh, yeah he hasn't PROVED it to me, I'll be honest, (Back To Normal Volume) Karl has't proved the existence of- of ghosts and poltergeists.
I have to say, Rick, I was- I was worried as soon as she got involved with the Ouija board.
I was thinking, "Please..."- I was thinking, "Please don't get involved with that Ouija board."
Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah. I was worried when- as soon as she said, "Oh, I heard some giggling from- coming from the other stable".
It- and what questions did she ask the Ouija board? You didn't ask that I noticed.
She didn't, she didn't want to...
Do you think it was something like "Why?" that you did to try and confuse the computer.
And the spirit world got really annoyed--
And they got confused and they came back and started messing up her clothes.
But what- what do you think then? There's- there's--
What do you mean?! What do you mean, "What do I think"?!
Well, what do you think? D'ya know what I mean?
Wha- wha- what- about what? There's nothing I can answer there (Pounding The Desk On Each Word) there's nothing I can answer.
Well I'll just keep saying I don't believe in the existence of ghosts... because of the impossibility.
Right, now when she said, I mean- the interview I did for fifty minutes--
Yeah, we might use that at Christmas or something, right...
What, that's the best you got out of fifty minutes?!
(Laughing) MTV are not gonna call again.
I'll tell you what, right... It did get a bit dark and, uhh, I didn't want- I didn't want that stuff, sort of, going out.
Don't want to spook people out on a Saturday afternoon, yeah.
I can, I can understand the heating thing, I said, "Well, you know..."- in the full interview I was saying, "You know, that- that could be anything couldn't it? Heating broke or something."
Now, she said the- the uhh... what else was she talking about?
Someone got into the bed next to her.
Yeah, I mean, I sort of said, "Well, umm, you know, how did that happen?"
And she couldn't explain it herself but--
I said, "But it did wake you up, maybe you were a little bit, ooh, bit still tired--"
Although the only explanation I can think of, as she didn't actually see anyone, is: well it was a ghost!
Yeah, yeah. Well that was my--
She's probably got a ghost in.
But what- what about her cupboards openin' and shuttin'?
See, that's- that- again, the only explanation for that is a ghost.
I can't think of anything else.
It's got to be a ghost.
It is ghosts, I think you've proven it to us.
"Street Spirit" - Radiohead. (Sarcastic Voice) So it turns out ghosts do exist --
(Sarcastic Voice)A woman, what Karl knows, proved it.
(Sarcastic Voice)I've got egg on my face.
Incidentally Rick, I should just encourage you and everyone else listening James R--
